results.title: The Magic rolling board
results.creator_credit: Jim Freeman, Greg MacGillivray, Freeman Films and MacGillivray Freeman Films
results.brief_description: A skateboarding extravaganza which captures every expression of the sport. Includes slow-motion shots, exhibitions of skill, stunts and mishaps.

results.title: The Magic rectangle: short multiplication
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math that counts”.
Uses rectangular arrays of square metres as a visual model for multiplication and explains the commutative property of multiplication.

results.title: The Magic pudding
results.brief_description: This is a magical animated version of the classic Australian children’s novel by Norman Lindsay. Featuring the vocal talents of John Cleese, Sam Neill, Geoffrey Rush, Hugo Weaving, Jack Thompson, Toni Collette and Mary Coustas, the film cannot fail to delight children of all ages. Come join Albert the Magic Pudding, Bunyip Bluegum, Bill Barnacle and Sam Sawnoff as they fight off the attempts of pudding thieves Possum and Wombat (directed from a distance by Buncle), and try valiantly to solve the mystery of the disappearance of Bunyip’s parents.

results.title: The Magic Portal
results.brief_description: he Magic Portal is a short stop motion film that uses LEGO®, plasticene, cardboard and pixellated live action, made between the years of 1985 and 1989 on good ol’ fashioned 16mm film.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion fantasies
constellations_other.description: The LEGO Movie draws on fan-made stop-motion films for its aesthetic style, but fantastical animation comes in many forms.

results.description: The Magic Portal is a short stop motion film that uses LEGO®, plasticene, cardboard and pixellated live action, made between the years of 1985 and 1989 on good ol’ fashioned 16mm film. The story concerns the strange fate of a LEGO astronaut called L, who discovers the Magic Portal on board his giant spaceship. The Portal takes him to a strange and surreal LEGO world where he has a close encounter with a Monster and barely escapes with his life. His report to Captain Paranoia only gets him to trouble and his friend and shipmate P, doesn’t believe him. However, the Portal has a mind of its own, and reappears to upset the cosy world of the giant spaceship and its crew to reveal weirder worlds more peculiar than the last…
description_for_label: The Magic Portal is a short stop motion film that uses LEGO®, plasticene, cardboard and pixellated live action, made between the years of 1985 and 1989 on good ol’ fashioned 16mm film. The story concerns the strange fate of a LEGO astronaut called L, who discovers the Magic Portal on board his giant spaceship. The Portal takes him to a strange and surreal LEGO world where he has a close encounter with a Monster and barely escapes with his life. His report to Captain Paranoia only gets him to trouble and his friend and shipmate P, doesn’t believe him. However, the Portal has a mind of its own, and reappears to upset the cosy world of the giant spaceship and its crew to reveal weirder worlds more peculiar than the last…

results.title: The Magic pear tree
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen, Alfred Wallace and Film Dimensions
results.brief_description: A tale about a pear peddler who is greedy and selfish, a poor old man who couldn’t afford to buy a pear, and a kind passer-by who buys a pear for the old man. Points out that we should have compassion for the poor and respect for the elderly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wan-go Wen, Alfred Wallace and Film Dimensions

results.title: The Magic Paintbrush
results.brief_description: A charming puppet animation based on a Chinese folk-tale. Ma Liang, the hero, is a poor peasant boy who loves to paint. One day a fairy gives him a magic paintbrush and he discovers that anything he paints will come to life. Ma Liang happily creates many things that the peasants desperately need until, one fateful day, a wicked landlord discovers his secret.

results.title: The Magic of Walt Disney world
results.creator_credit: Tom Leetch, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Disneyland was the prototype for this larger, more advanced amusement park in Florida. The range of attractions for the tourist are accordingly diverse and spectacular, from the Polynesian Village to the monorail ride and the Fort Wilderness camping ground.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Leetch, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Animation Studios

results.title: The Magic of the faraway tree. [Vol. 2] = More adventures at the faraway tree
results.creator_credit: Ben Turner, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of six short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Magic of the faraway tree” featuring more fantastic adventures with Joe, Fran and Beth and their Faraway Tree friends. Be amazed in the land of Giants, careful in the land of Topsy Turvy where you might end upside down, and watch those magic spells in the land of Wizards. Excellent animation with lots of colour and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Magic of the faraway tree. [Vol. 1]
results.creator_credit: Ben Turner, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of seven short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Magic of the faraway tree”. Join in with the Magic Faraway Tree characters and their friends, Joe, Fran and Beth and experience some of their fantastic adventures in the many strange and magical lands at the top of the Faraway Tree. Beautifully animated with lots of colour, vibrancy and action. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Magic of electricity
results.brief_description: Takes viewer on a tour of Yallourn Power Station, “Victoria’s most important power house”, explaining how electricity is made and distributed within Victoria and Melbourne in particular.
